Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Temporin-GHd (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; XXA, UCLL1c; BBMm)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 61.5% similarity toTemporin-GHc. molecular formula: C76H108N18O16; Mol Wt: 1529.808; GRAVY = 1.2.Activity: Active against Gram+, Gram- bacteria and fungi. Active against Gram+ S. aureus ATCC 43300 MRSA or ATCC 25923 (MIC 12.7 uM); B.subtilis ATCC 6633 (MIC 102.3 uM); Gram- E. coli ATCC 25922 or D31 (12.7-25.5 uM); V. alginolyticus IS (MIC 12.7 uM);  P. aeruginosa ATCC 15442 (MIC 51 uM); and C. albicans ATCC 10231 (MIC 25.5 uM). The peptide is also active against S. mutans (MIC 13.1 uM) biofilms(MBIC50 6.6 uM)(Zhong et al. et al., 2019).Structure: Helical in 50% TFE or 30 mM SDS. Provided by Yingxia Zhang. Updated Jan2020 GW
Literature Information.Author: Dong Z, Luo W, Zhong H, Wang M, Song Y, Deng S, Zhang Y.2017, China, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: Acta Biochim Biophys Sin (Shanghai). 2017 May 1;49(5):450-457. doi: 10.1093/abbs/gmx023.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Molecular cloning and characterization of antimicrobial peptides from skin of Hylarana guentheri.
